Posts.Content: alisonperry wrote: Hi, I am coming to this site to help myself keep busy because I am going crazy after waiting two weeks for the results.   I lost my mom to breast cancer, grandmother and great grandmother and have 2 cousins and an aunt who fought the good fight and won. So lots of history.   About 3 months ago very high up on my breast, lower than collar bone but higher than areola, I saw a red spot and thought "hmm spider bite"  a week later still there but bigger so I think "hmm rash from sweating" because I am a long distance runner.    Well then two weeks after that I got that nasty cough flu floating around and doc put me on Zithromax and I figured that would clear up the spot.   It did not and it continued to grow into this circular form.  So then I thought, ringworm?  BUT no itching, or flaking.   Fast foward to about 3 weeks ago I went to the General Doc and he was stumped because it is not itchy, flaky it's just like a branding almost, raised red circular, so he did mammogram ultrasound and nothing and the radiologist said "I highly doubt this is IBC", so then I was sent to a dermotologist two weeks ago and he did punch biopsy and I swear that this waiting is AWFUL!!!   They said one week, then they said a couple days more and then they said today and come 4 p.m. when I called they said "Still don't have results"  and I am going insane.  Now tonight, after staring at my breasts in the mirror for the thousandth time, I am THINKING, that I am noticing that my breast with the circular red brand like rash/mark  has increased in size and is all of a sudden sagging, drooping more and the areola has drooped a lot, OR AM I GOING CRAZY and this was there all the time but I have never stared at my own breasts so much that I never noticed it.     And now I have to get through yet another weekend and I am going insane.   ANYBODY at all have these kind of marks, symptoms.   Again, no hotness, no itching but this odd marking and size difference.     Whatever information at this point from anyone would be a welcome, calming voice, thanks so much.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy two weeks ago for possible IBC, still no results from lab alisonperry alisonperry

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2013 08:18AM alisonperry wrote: thanks april485 and farmerlucyd posters!!!!  It stinks that us girls (and while small, a majority of males) have to deal with this rotten prospect but HOW Great to have a site like this to support, cheer on and quell one another's fears, concerns.   You are so right about how far we have come with research from just 10 years ago so hopefully by the time my daughters have to make the decision for the test their options will be even better than ours (not to mention the odds).    April I too will be cheering you on in the prayer corner for benign results and I will also, post when I hear my news.   Sad that we are hoping and praying that we are CRAZY,  that's the saddest part about this situation of waiting, we are either "over reacting and just jumping to conclusions" or we were correct, not great but the first time in my life I am praying I'm crazy.    My hope is that they perfect the biopsy process down because the amount of damage we do to ourselves sitting at home worrying or looking up pictures on internet saying "oh that sounds like what I have" or what have you, that is torture.   Last night I was having very uncomfortable upper back pain and I thought it was from sitting on internet so long looking up breast cancer but then I saw that upper back pain could be a sign too!!   So of course I jacked up the worry button again and had terrible night sleep.    But then I remember what you posted farmerlucyd and you are right, it will come when it is all checked out and confirmed, either way and until then thats how it is.   It is what it is.    So as I write this I am dressed for a run and I run for sanity so I will probably end up running 8 miles this morning, ha ha, lots to get off my mind.    Well thanks again girls, I'll post when I hear and just want to thank you both (all) again for your voices, kindness and this site.

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2013 08:38PM alisonperry wrote: Thank you so much for your much appreciated words of comfort, advice, experience and opinion.   You are right I would rather have it be thoroughly looked at and absolute, then rushed and innacurate and I didn't even think about all these Q R and S storms lately, good point.   Yes, after my mom passed away from bc, 3 years ago, my cousin (a bc survivor herself) highly rec. the genetic tests and at the time fear kept me from going forward because I have two daughters, (13 and 16, I am 47 myself) and I thought "O.k. so if I am positive then do I put that burden on them now or later to find out if they are?" and now, hindsight, that I am possibly staring down this barrell, I wished I had.   So if all comes back negative and just a "scare" the first thing I am going to do is look into the testing for myself, and take care of business after results.  As for my girls I suppose we will cross that bridge when they themselves are ready.     Best way to deal with the fear, or the only way really, is to stare it down and face it, even if we are shaking in our boots the whole time. Thank you thank you thank you, you truly helped me so much and I will rest easy for the rest of this weekend.   So grateful. Alison
